title: Grammar & Syntax - MODERATE Level
description: ‚úçÔ∏è Move beyond the basics! This quiz tests your understanding of $\text{verb \, mood}$ üé≠, **complex sentence structures** ‚õìÔ∏è, **subordinating conjunctions**, and common $\text{syntactic \, errors}$. (20 Questions - 40 Minutes)

questions.text: A sentence containing one independent clause and one or more dependent clauses is called a $\mathbf{...}$ sentence.
Which type of clause can stand alone as a complete sentence?
Identify the error in the following sentence: 'Running quickly, the bus was missed.'
The $\mathbf{Subjunctive \, Mood}$ is most often used to express...

options.c: A wish, hypothetical situation, or necessity

questions.text: In the sentence, 'I wish $\mathbf{I \, were}$ taller,' the verb 'were' is an example of which mood?
A common error where two independent clauses are joined only by a comma is known as a $\mathbf{...}$?
Which word is a $\mathbf{Subordinating \, Conjunction}$?
What is the function of the $\mathbf{gerund}$ phrase in the sentence: 'She enjoys $\mathbf{reading \, books}$.'?
A pronoun that refers to an earlier noun (the antecedent) must agree with it in...
In the sentence, 'The box was carried by the student,' the verb is in the $\mathbf{...}$ voice.
Which verb form is used to create the $\mathbf{perfect \, tenses}$ (e.g., 'have eaten')?
A sentence that combines two or more independent clauses and one or more dependent clauses is called $\mathbf{...}$?
Which punctuation mark is used to join two independent clauses without a coordinating conjunction?
What is the function of the phrase $\mathbf{to \, run}$ in the sentence: 'He likes $\mathbf{to \, run}$.'?
Which word is a $\mathbf{Coordinating \, Conjunction}$ (FANBOYS)?
A sentence that gives a direct command or instruction is in the $\mathbf{...}$ mood.
In the sentence, 'The woman $\mathbf{who \, is \, wearing \, a \, blue \, hat}$ is my aunt,' the bold part is what kind of clause?
The $\mathbf{possessive \, form}$ of the plural noun 'students' is:
A $\mathbf{Fused \, Sentence}$ is when two independent clauses are joined with...
Which tense is formed by using 'will have' plus the past participle?
